instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed ‚Äì if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed ‚Äì if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Hello again to everyone,

Its me again :) As you may remember I had a problem with fans and slow working with this computer and it was totally trackpad. I found out that I ve knocked out the sensor of trackpad. But now I have realised that computer does not wake up after lid closed and opened. It stays on black screen. The computert keeps working and I realised that my power button also does not work after I open the lid to shut down the computer. Any idea where it can happen from?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
This should be caused by one Hall sensor.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT levels.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Hello yeah I think I found the problem. This just came off from the top of left hall sensor. I think this is the problem but I dont know if I can find this from anywhere else.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://resimyukle.io/r/w7oP86QnGY[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
That is small package Hall sensor; probably SOT-323, or even smaller.
You can find a replacement from any <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/7/8 board.

Some boards have the sensor glued; need patience to remove it.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Check this:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://pdf1.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/644297/MURATA/MRMS205A.html[/URL]
Your should be Mini 3Pin FLP package.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message: This is perfect I can check the boards I have if they have any of these.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
I think I saw W73 (MRSS32W) on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.

W55/71/73/86 is the same...
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.eric1688.com/product.aspx?id=370614[/URL]

Can I ask how should I check these levels? Sorry Im really new to all these macbooks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Hi Again,

When I checked the second leg of J5260 on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> on diode mode, it gives me around 0.505 but when I checked the one on J5250 2nd leg it gives me 2,860 so I dont know which one is the right one and working well :)) Can you help me about diode measurements so I can check them later again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
About diode mode checking (and mode), read this:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

I was expecting you to check voltage of mentioned signals.

You can tie together pins 1 & 2 of <CHIP>U5255</CHIP>.
And let disconnected the bad Hall sensor.
One lid sensor should be sufficient...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Ohh I am sorry I didnt know that I had to check voltages. Im sorry as I said Im new to these business and trying to update myself about everything always. 
So could you please clear me with telling how to tie 1&2 pins and how to disconnect the bad hall sensor?
Can you please tell me a bit more explained?
Thank you for your patience. üôè

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message:
Pufff, <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> is small BGA.
Try to run an wire from [1]<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT_R</SIGNAL> (pin 1/<RESISTOR>R5258</RESISTOR>) to TP[1]<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> test point; find them on boardview.
One sensor should do the job.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Does Not Wake Up After Lid Closed
threads.message: Thank you for your patience :) Okay will do and let you about it
